body:
The same happens with me. 
Looks similar to the issue with vs code PS ext. https://github.com/PowerShell/vscode-powershell/issues/742
I wondered as well if the two issues aren't related.
Because I had nothing left to try, I created profile scripts and put in the [System.Console]::OutputEncoding = [System.Text.Encoding]::ASCII line from the VSCode issue. Didn't make any difference.

This is interesting. I was able to get something like this to work in the Bash shell.
```
powershell -nologo -OutputFormat Text -command "&{Get-Process}"
```

I Already logged the incident in WSL GitHub awhile ago: PowerShell 6.0.0-beta hung up in Windows 10 Bash Console. https://github.com/Microsoft/BashOnWindows/issues/2124

:)

But, I can still use PowerShell in Windows 10 Bash in Ubuntu Desktop. 

![poshbeta_bashgui_2017-05-17_10-28-40](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19892435/26170150/615b49fe-3b0e-11e7-91b3-75dfb1408a33.jpg)

I can see what I'm supposed to be running.
```
jeff@YPJH10:/home$ powershell -nologo -command "&{Get-Variable PSVersionTable | Select -expand Value}"

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.0-beta
PSEdition                      Core
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0
CLRVersion
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-beta.1
OS                             Linux 4.4.0-43-Microsoft #1-Microsoft Wed Dec 31 14:42:53 PST 2014
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

But!...  You can't get to the prompt.  Does by any chance, have you installed .NET Core in Bash?
:)

I got the notice on WSL "Microsoft .net Core team and powershell team have active bugs listed on this github repo."

:)
Not sure what version of .NET core is running in my Bash shell. I'm going through the .NET Core 2.0 Preview 1 setup now.

@jdhitsolutions,

I can tell you, installing .NET Core 2.0 Preview, that won't work.  It  was working before installing.

I'm more tempted to do a clean Bash setup, then do a PowerShell Beta install to see if the .NET Core 2.0 Preview had something to do with PowerShell not opening.  

But, I will have to do this on my VM at home after work this evening.

FYI
I completed testing PowerShell 6.0.0-beta on my Window 10 Bash Console. I uninstall and did a clean Bash installation without .NET Core 2.0 Preview 1 and PowerShell is getting hung.

1. lxrun /uninstall /full
2. lxrun /install
3. Open Bash Console.
4. sudo su ##-> Prepare for PowerShell Beta Install
    curl https://packages.microsoft.com/keys/microsoft.asc | sudo apt-key add -
    curl https://packages.microsoft.com/config/ubuntu/16.04/prod.list | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/microsoft.list
     exit
5. sudo apt update
6. sudo apt upgrade ##-> This command will also install PowerShell
7. Open PowerShell ##-> But it hungs, the prompt won't come up.

![powershellhungbash](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19892435/26181406/cf872b30-3b3d-11e7-800b-e1df14e3d0d7.PNG)

@daviwil !!

I did follow part of your instructions to see if I could bypass the issue with PowerShell in Bash creating the "profile.ps1" on $pshome.  I got it to echo me back but still the prompt won't show up.

profile.ps1
[System.Console]::OutputEncoding = [System.Text.Encoding]::ASCII
Write-Host "PowerShell on Bash 6.0.0-beta.1 loaded"

Any ideas!! So, freaking close. 
:)

![bashposhissue_2017-05-18_21-17-01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19892435/26265354/d5074b22-3cae-11e7-85a5-c4f0aeeb6ba0.jpg)
That one I'm not certain about, unfortunately.  Hopefully they'll fix these issues with an upcoming Fast Ring build.  Let me check and see if I have a new Canary build to try with...

Thanks @daviwil!  At least the VS Code workaround was nice!!  
I've been using XServer and Ubuntu Desktop in Windows 10 which hasn't been that bad to work with PowerShell on Linux.

Greatly Appreciated,
:)
Looks like I have access to 16202, will spin it up and give it a shot :)

Awesome @daviwil! I'll keep my finger crossed!! 
:)
Same problem in 16202 :(

Well,  at least I'm not on a total lost as I can use Ubuntu Desktop Terminal to run PowerShell without any issues.  I know it will come around and be fixed later.

Thanks again,
:)

This still appears to be an issue with beta 2. I can run commands like this 
```
powershell -nologo -command "&{Get-process | sort-object WS -desc | select -first 5}"
```
but no interactive session.

Not sure if this will clarify things or make it more confusing. But on a clean Windows 10 build 14393 I installed WSL and then PowerShell beta 2. It works as expected. It does not work on Windows build 16199. At least for me.
Both the Windows console and WSL is changing, so it's going to be hard to determine what is actually causing the issue here.  We should revisit this when the console and WSL stabilize.
I feel everything is a moving target these days. For what it's worth, on the older Win10 platforms WSL installs Ubuntu 14.04.05 LTS but in the latest builds it installs 16.04.2 LTS.

Here's an update: Just installed a new Windows 10 build (16215). Thought I'd try this again, and it worked! Now, I also updated Ubuntu before I tried and it looks like I got some libc stuff so I don't know what made a difference. But I will say, that PSReadline caused issues typing. Cursor would jump back and forth on the line, sometimes it seemed even prematurely inserting a return,and in general caused a distracting typing experience.

@jdhitsolutions the display problem is https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/1829

Since you have this working and this issue isn't actionable by us, I'm closing.
